loans.name: Naimzhon

texts.en: Naimzhon lives in a town with his wife, who is seamstress, and 4 children. The family earns their main income from farming; they cultivate potatoes and onion. He has been busy with this business for more than 13 years. In addition to farming, Naimzhon also helps his wife to sell the clothes which she has sewn. He has applied for this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers. From the profit he plans to improve their living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for his land where he grows onion and potatoes.

loans.name: Gad

texts.en:
Gad is married with three children, two of whom go to school. He grows sugar cane to produce "waragi" (a local brew). It is his major source of income to support the family and he has been in this business since 2007. Gad and his wife also have a retail shop at home which she operates.
Gad is now requesting a loan of 500,000 Shillings to pay the labourers that work to clear the sugar cane plantation and add some capital into the retail business. His challenge is mainly the bad weather which affects the plantations.

loans.use: to pay labourers to clear the sugar cane plantation.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is 26 years old, married and has been blessed with five children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.
For the past three years, she has operated a café, her potential customers are the local residents. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation and seasonality in her place of operation.
With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with one child, who is not yet in school. She takes care of an additional family member (her young brother). She has a retail shop and has been in this business for 2 years. She works in the shop six days out of every week. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesale only store and also to buy a plot of land to build rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Desteo

texts.en:
Desteo is a 43-year-old married man who has five children, four of whom attend school. He is a farmer involved in cattle and sugar cane growing .The farm enables him to take care of his family. He has been practicing agriculture since 1993, but on a smaller scale.
Desteo now wants a loan of 800,000 shillings to buy a bull for his farm and also expand the farm. His dream is to see the farm expand and to have many cows which will give him milk that he can sell and improve his earnings. His main challenges are the diseases which attack animals and the unreliable weather that at times affects the pasture that the animals feed on.
In the photograph is the loan officer in a white shirt and the client with some of his cows.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is 22 years old. He lives in a small village of the Zestaponi District with his wife and grandparents, who are provided with a retirement pension. Ramin requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 4 milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese at local markets. Besides, they have 0.8 hectare of agricultural land. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Ramin requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Ramin has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Ramin will purchase a minibus. After purchasing a minibus, he will gather scrap iron from his village and then he will deliver it and earn money from it at the scrapyard. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus to haul scrap iron.

loans.name: Alba Del Carmen

texts.es:
Alba, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio, ya que los créditos son una fuente favorable para generar ingresos; este le permitirá comprar cerdos para engordarlos y luego llevarlos a la venta.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a crecer y obtener mayores ingresos. Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado y las condiciones económicas asimismo, ya que tiene mejores mayores ingresos y tienen una mejor estabilidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alba is requesting a loan to invest in her business and generate income. With the loan she will be able to buy pigs to fatten and sell.

The previous loan helped her to grow and receive a higher income. Family circumstances have improved as well as its economy, now that she has a higher income and more stability in life.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Blanca Herminia

texts.es:
Blanca, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir en la comprar de mercadería para seguir en la venta; este le permitirá comprar carteras de cuero para posteriormente llevarlas a la venta.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar sus ingresos y su clientela, las ganancias las invierte en la alimentación y vestuario, asimismo compra de medicina; las condiciones económicas han mejorado gracias al crédito otorgado de Kiva, se mantiene el grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Blanca is requesting a new loan to buy merchandise and continue selling it. She will be able to buy leather purses to sell.

The previous loan helped her to increase her income and her customer base. She invests her profits in food, clothes and medicine. Her financial situation has improved thanks to the loan she received from Kiva and her family is also fine.

loans.use: to buy leather purses to sell.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be reliable. 

He operates a clothes retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an urban area where customers are many. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. 

His business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be prosperous. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced mother and has been blessed with four children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a fish selling business from home. She sells primarily to local neighbours. Fatuma dreams of expanding and establishing a shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth produces palm oil in Wegbe, Hohoe community. Elizabeth has never been to school due to financial reasons and her parent didn’t see the need to send a girl child to school.  She is divorced and has 3 children. 

Elizabeth has been producing and selling palm oil for the past three years, after her husband divorced her, to makes ends meet. She is responsible for the general upkeep of herself and that of her children. 

Her loan will be used to buy heads of palm fruit and get labour to help in production. She intendeds to save and use the new profits from her expanded business to give a better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy heads of palm fruit and get labour to help in production.

loans.name: 3 Stars Group

texts.en:
Darine is the featured borrower of 3 Stars Group. She got with the other group members to apply for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends. Darine is a 23-year-old single woman who is working in a clothes selling shop since a year ago in order to cover her education fees. She is studying interior design, and it is her second educational year. She is the one in the middle. The applied for loan will be invested in paying for her college fees.

Manal is a 24-year-old single woman. She is the one on the left. She works as a cashier in clothes selling domain also in order to make her living. She will invest the loan in paying for her wedding needs. Aya is an 18-year-old single woman, who works in selling clothes to make her living. The applied for loan will be invested in paying for her driving license fees.

loans.use: to pay for her College fees

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from two to 12 years. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a grocery stall where she sells groceries. Rosemary has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an urban area where there are many customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more groceries like cassava to sell. Her business goal is to expand the business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
For the past several years, Mwanasha has operated a vegetable selling business, selling farm products at the market and to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. Drought is especially a major challenge to her business. She dreams of establishing another business in the near future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts, cassava and mango fruits. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts, cassava and mango fruits.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 34-year-old married man with 3 children. This is his third successive loan with SMEP DTM. He plans to get a loan of 100,000 KES to buy animal feed for his dairy cattle. He plans to expand his business so as to supply Maua, his town, with milk. In the future, he sees himself developing a processing firm to supply milk to his residents in Maua.

loans.use: to buy feed for his dairy animals.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is a 54-year-old married man who is honest and credible. He is applying for a loan of 100,000 KES to help him buy and sell cattle to make a profit. This is his third successive loan through SMEP DTM. He sees himself as the leading cattle trader in the area who supplies to the local butchers in Maua region.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman with three children. She is an honest lady who aims to get a loan of 20,000 KES to finance on her business to buy maize and sell it at a profit. She sees herself as a wholesaler in the next five years. Profits made from her business will be used to restock her shop. This is her second successive loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy maize.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is an honest 21-year-old married woman with a child. She is applying for a 50,000 KES loan to open a wholesale chemical and fertilizer business to supply her residents in Maua. This is her second successive loan with SMEP. She sees herself in five years as the leading wholesale dealer in her region.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and agro-chemicals.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 46 years old. She lives in Dzirkoki village, Gurjaani District with her husband Sergo, their three children and her retired mother in-law. Lela has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 
The family owns a vineyard. With the harvested grapes they make wine and vodka. The products are sold locally at the markets. They also have a horse which is rented out seasonally for a small income. Additional income for the family comes from Lela’s mother in-law’s monthly pension. 
Lela requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Lela has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Lela will start trading with fruits and vegetables. She will purchase a car and agricultural products from the reseller in Gurjaani district, bring the products to the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, and sell at the local market.  Part of the profit Lela will use for reinvesting in the same business and develop her trading. Another part she will use for the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a car and fruit and vegetables for trading

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a married woman who is 28 years old and operates a salon and tailoring business. She has been in business for 3 years and plans to use the loan to develop both businesses by purchasing supplies. She faces a challenge of lack of enough demand in the market. Irene plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and sees her businesses stable in five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy salon items and materials to make clothes.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 48-year-old married man who is trustworthy. He is looking for a loan of 100,000 KES to expand his butcher business. He will use the loan to purchase livestock for slaughter in his hometown of Maua. This is his fourth successive loan with SMEP DTM. He has a vision of growing his butcher shop to be a leading business in his hometown.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for slaughter

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is married and has been blessed with five children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. She cites food and school fees as her major expenses.

Theresia operates a fruit selling business. She sells at retail to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of the bulkiness of goods, hence the high cost of transportation. 

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits for resale.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is married with six school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-greengrocery in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. Josphine decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Hughes

texts.en:
Hughes is a married man with five children under his care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He has operated a fruit selling business for the past 8 years. He sells at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation of fruit from rural areas to urban areas. His major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area and thus to raise his profits.

With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons and pawpaw. He decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, watermelon and pawpaw.

loans.name: Rumba

texts.en:
Rumba is a married man with five children, four of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for the past seven years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He faces the major challenge of debtors waiting too long to repay money for goods bought on credit. 

With the loan Rumba is requesting, he wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Santos Salvador

texts.es:
Santos, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, ya que los préstamos son una fuente fortalecedora para generar ingresos; este le permitirá comprar abono y asimismo para la preparación de la tierra.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos; este le ayudo a optimizar el negocio, ofreció una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ya que las circunstancias familiares han mejorado y también las condiciones económicas.
texts.en: Santos is requesting a loan so he can continue to invest in his business, as these loans have been a strong source of income. They have enabled him to buy manure and prepare the earth. The loan he received previously helped him increase his supplies and obtain more income, which helped him optimize his business and offer a better quality of life to his family. As a result, his family life has improved, as has his economic situation.

loans.use: buy manure and prepare the earth.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 30-year-old married man and the father of four children. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2000. In 2008 he opened his own business to increase his income and improve his family's living standards. His wife doesn't work. She takes good care of her family members and makes sure that they are all getting what they need. She puts so much effort into educating them properly.

Hassan is developing his business gradually. To make sure that he finishes his work requests on time, he is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to buy a power generator that will make his work easier, since they have a major electricity problem in his area and he needs it to finish his work.

This will be his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing paying back history. He hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can to provide his family with their necessary needs.

loans.use: To buy a power generator necessary for his business.

loans.name: Mbwana

texts.en:
Mbwana is married and has been blessed with two children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He cites food and school fees as his major expenses.

He operates a fruit selling business, selling at retail prices to his neighbors and town dwellers. He faces a major challenge of the bulkiness of goods, hence the high cost of transportation. 

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase sacks of fruits for resale. Mbwana decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits for resale.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 24-year-old single man who has been working in a food business for two years. He has a convenience store in his village and is working hard to develop it in a very managed way.

He is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase his business merchandise with special released spring and summer beverages, to please his customers as much as he can.

This is Hassan's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes that it will have an excellent impact on his business. He expects that future loans will also be invested in increasing the merchandise diversity in his store to attract new customers' attention.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise with special spring and summer beverages.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung would like to take a further loan to repair her stall and buy quality food to sell. Dung's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To repair her stall and buy quality food to sell.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung is requesting a new loan to repair her food stall and buy new furniture. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To repair her food stall and buy new furniture.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying more cosmetics and cellphones to sell to customers. Thao's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and cellphones.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
Walter,  requiere de un nuevo crédito por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en la compra de productos agropecuarios, ya que realiza cultivo de granos básicos; este le servirá para comprar cuatro sacos de abono y pagar la mano de obra.
El préstamo anterior le permitió aumentar la productividad y los ingresos los invirtió en los gastos del hogar; con la inversión del crédito otorgado por Kiva las condiciones económicas se han optimizado, asimismo las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en: Walter cultivates basic grains and is requesting a loan to continue investing in farming products. The loan will help him buy 4 bags of manure and pay for manual labor. The previous loan enabled him to increase productivity and the income generated was invested in the household expenses. With the Kiva loan he was able to optimize his economic situation and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy 4 bags of manure and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат – хрупкая, маленькая женщина с сильной силой духа и со стойким характерам  как у мужчин.   Она и мама и папа для своих детей.    После развода с мужем она нашла в себе силы – не сдалась и поставила себя и своих детей на ноги.   Ей было очень тяжело поначалу, так как Адолат не находила работу из-за отсутствия диплома о высшем образовании. Но собрав все силы в кулак, решила заняться мелким предпринимательством. Закупила лепешек с первых рук и продавала с прибылью. Прошло девятнадцать лет, Адолат расширила бизнес.    Теперь ей доставляют лепёшки на место деятельности. Повзрослевшие дети также помогают маме и друг другу. Чтобы помочь сыну с работой Адолат решила купить ему автомашину.   Её сын планирует утром и вечером работать на «службе по доставке колбасных изделий» а днём предлагать услуги таксиста. С этими целями обратилась а МДО «Арванд» за помощью. Очень надеется и верит на поддержку со стороны организации и Арванд.
texts.en: Adolat is a frail, small woman with a strong spirit and firm character. She serves as both the mother and father of her children. After divorcing her husband, she found her inner strength — she did not give up, and got herself and her children on their feet. At first it was very difficult for her, for Adolat could not find work without a college diploma. But she mustered up her courage and decided to get involved in small business. She bought some cakes and resold them for a profit. 19 years later, Adolat expanded her business. Now cakes are delivered to her shop. Her adult children are also helping her, as well as each other. In order to help her with his job, Adolat has decided to buy him a car. Her plans is planning to work mornings and evenings at the "Sausage Products Delivery Service". During the day he plans to work as a private taxi driver. With this goal, Adolat has come to Arvand for help. She has strong hopes and faith in assistance from Arvand.

loans.use: to buy a car for her son

loans.name: Maa Mangala Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Mangala Self Help Group consists of eight women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to share their problems and to solve their problems among themselves.
 
One of them is Anusaya, who was selected as the president of the group. The lady standing fourth from left side in the photo is Anusaya. Anusaya is 23 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. She has two acres of land in her village and she is using her land in rice cultivation. Her husband is supporting her in this activity.
 
She has requested a loan to help her to purchase the required resources for rice cultivation such as seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labour charges.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is aged 23 years old, single but with three children aged four, two and one year old. .Due to Edward's parents' lack of school fees, he was unable to go further with his studies so he dropped out of school at a tender age. After dropping out of school, he started doing motorcycle transport ('boda boda') to get money for survival and he has been doing that since 2010. But the motorcycle was not his; it belonged to someone else.

Edward now wants a loan of 1,800,000 shillings to add onto his savings and buy his own motorcycle for 3,300,000 shillings. His dream is to save money from the motorcycle-riding business and buy land to get involved in agriculture so he can diversify his earnings.

The major challenge Edward faces is the poor road network, most especially affecting business when it rains. In the photograph is the loan officer with a tie and the client at the client's home.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle of his own

loans.name: Maa Harachandi Self Help Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of neighbours and friends who formed the group Maa Harachandi Self Help Group. The members of the group have selected Sukanti as their president. The lady standing fourth from left hand side wearing a red saree in the photo is Sukanti. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity.

Sukanti is a 38 years old, married and living with her husband in the village Balipatna in the Khurda district of Odisha, India. Sukanti is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. She has a business of growing vegetables and paddy and selling them in the market of the Khurda district of Odisha, India. She has already had this business for three years, and it is going very well. 

At this time, Sukanti is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming.

loans.name: Hidjran

texts.en:
Hidjran is 31 years old, married, and already has two children: a 5-year-old daughter and a 2-year-old son. His daughter goes to preschool. He wants his daughter to become a doctor. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. 

Hidjran is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with his family. He started his business 3 years ago selling meat. 

Now Hidjran needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy calves and sheep to sell as meat at his butcher shop. He wants to use the money from his expanded business to help his family. In the future, Hidjran wants to buy a fridge for his shop. This will be more profitable for his business. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy calves and sheep

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is single with no children and also doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a boutique selling used clothes and has been in this business for 3 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  She works in a shop   six days out of every week and sells her clothes on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of used clothes.  She is aspiring of importing used clothes and also building rental rooms. She resides in her own house and has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include  paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys sells materials and clothes in Hohoe. Gladys has received education to junior high school.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is a petty trader. Gladys has been selling material and clothes for two years now. She helps her husband to cater for the home and support other extended family members. Her loan will be used to buy bundles of clothes, materials and introduce the sale of linen. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to enable her to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes, materials, and introduce the sale of linen.

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en:
Rauf is 29 years old, married and the father of a child aged 2 years. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income for the family. Rauf is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. He lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. He is applying for his first loan from Kiva to buy  medication to sell. 

Rauf will use the 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy a different medication for some renal failure clients. He will use the additional income he earns from this loan to better care for his family. Rauf is thankful to Komak and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy  medication for resale

loans.name: Maa Adishakti Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Adishakti Self Help Group consists of 10 members of whom all are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. 

One of them is Gita who was selected as their president. Gita is a 22-year-old lady living with her husband and her three children. The lady sitting in the middle wearing a white saree is Gita. Her husband works as a labourer in a factory situated near her village. 

She runs a variety shop to help her husband financially. She sells betel, grains, lentils, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to meet her customers' demands. She also wants to purchase items for her shop in bulk, directly from the wholesalers. For this she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, rice and other household consumables.

Gita, along with her group members, has requested a loan amount of 130,000 INR.

loans.use: to pay for toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, rice and other household consumables for her variety shop.

loans.name: Mirbagir

texts.en: Mirbagir is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and now lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. He is 34 years old, married, and has 2 sons, a 12-year-old and a 9-year-old. Mirbagir's sons go to school. He wants his sons to go into business. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. Mirbagir started his business 10 month ago, to sell cell phone accessories, some phones and phone numbers. Now he needs a 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy phone accessories. He wants to use the money from his new business to help his family and to provide a good future for his children. Mirbagir is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories for his shop.

loans.name: Rodolfo  Antonio

texts.es:
Rodolfo, es un joven de 27 años de edad, originario de León, él estudia segundo año de la carrera de Ingeniería sistema, pero trabaja vendiendo ropa usada y calzado. Este negocio lo empezó junto con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a lo mismo él tenía una moto la cual vendió para poner su negocio. En este negocio tiene un ayudante el cual le paga por venta al igual el que se encarga de comprar los paquetes de ropa y distribuirlo siempre en busca de nuevos clientes.  
El este necesitando el financiamiento para comprar camisas , pantalones, zapatos para dama y caballero. Uno de sus planes futuros es poner otro negocio como venta de pollos rosticisados. Una de sus metas próximas es terminar su carrera y estudiar administración de empresas.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is a 27-year-old youngster, who originates from León. He's in his second year of Systems Engineering, but sells used clothing and shoes. He started this business with his parents who were also in the same line of work. He owned a motorcycle, which he then sold so he could start his business. He has a helper whom he pays on commission, who is also in charge of buying the packs of clothing and distributing them, always looking for new clients. 
He needs this loan to buy shirts, pants, and women's and men's shoes. One of his plans for the future is to open a chicken roasting business. One of his next goals is to finish his degree and study business administration.

loans.use: buy shirts, pants and women's and men's shoes.

loans.name: Boakye

texts.en: Boakye deals in the general merchants in Hohoe market and surrounding towns in Hohoe. Boakye has received schooling but only to junior high school level. He is single. Boakye has been in the selling business for 8 years now. He is responsible for the general upkeep of himself and other family members. His loan will be used to buy cartons of torch lights, varieties of LED lights, and electrical plugs. He hopes to use the new profits from his expanded business to save to enable him acquire a shop one day.

loans.use: to buy cartons of torch lights, varieties of LED lights, and electrical plugs.

loans.name: Maa Jageswari Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Jageswari Self Help Group consists of 11 members, of whom all are women residing in the same neighborhood. The members of this group are very responsible and ambitious. 

One of them is Tikan, who is a 54-year-old lady living with her husband and her two children. She is engaged in running a small furniture shop. She takes orders from her customers for making doors, chairs, tables, etc., and gets them ready with the help of her labourers. She earns 8,000 INR per month from this activity, which is not sufficient for her family to survive on. 

She wants to enlarge her business by taking orders in bulk from her customers and fulfilling their demands on time. She wants to purchase new and advanced tools for making furniture and some wooden logs to prepare ready-made furniture like small tables, coffee tables, etc.

Tikan, along with her group, has applied for the loan amount of 275,000 INR. She has a plan to use her portion of the loan for purchasing the above items. She says that by doing so, her family's monthly income will increase and she will be able to give her family a good living standard.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing wooden logs and some new and advanced tools for her furniture shop.

loans.name: Ayaz

texts.en:
Ayaz is 39 years old and single. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with his mother. His mother stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. 

This is Ayaz's first loan from Kiva. He started his business six month ago to sell home goods. He has a shop named "1001 Hirdavat," meaning that he sells everything needed at every home. 

Now Ayaz needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy home goods for resale at his shop. He wants to use the money from his new business to help his mother because she is ill.

In the future, Ayaz wants to have a bigger shop for more goods. This will be more profitable for his business. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy home goods for resale.

loans.name: Helene

texts.en:
This is Helene, a 58-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married, living with her husband. They are both cooperating together to live a respectable life. Her husband is a hard worker. He works in installing curtains and has many years of experience in this occupation.  

As for her, she started her own home business as a tailor in 2000. She has stylish designs and seeks to please her customers the best she can. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new tailoring machine in order to improve her business and therefore increase her productivity. Helene has big responsibilities and this is the perfect time to better develop her work and augment her earnings. She’s planning to open her own tailoring shop and also expand her business outside the country as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 35 years old and married with four children between seven and 16 years old. Since 2008, she has run a general store in Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown where she sells milk, soap, cigarettes, and soft drinks. Her major business challenges are price inflation and electricity to cool her drinks.

Kadiatu is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy milk, soap, cigarettes, and soft drinks. She will use the extra income from her loan to expand her business and pay her children's school fees. Despite her hardships, Kadiatu  hopes to expand her business and educate her children. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy milk, soap, cigarettes, and soft drinks

loans.name: Diana Epifania

texts.es:
Diana, casada, madre de tres hijos de oficio comerciante se dedica a elaborar y vender pan actividad que realiza junto con su esposo. Anteriormente el negocio era de su suegra pero actualmente lo dirige ella.  Sus productos los vende y distribuye en mercados y pulperías de manera ambulante. 
Ella solicito el crédito para comprar harina, aceite, levadura, azúcar, polvo de hornear, dulces, saborizantes, mermeladas.
Su sueño es poner otra panadería mas grande con un horno industrializado para ya no utilizar un horno de leña y aumentar la producción y poder contratar a mas personas.
texts.en:
Diana is married and the mother of three children.  She's a merchant by trade and earns her living making and selling bread, a job she does with her husband.  Previously the business belonged to her mother-in-law but currently she runs it.  She sells and distributes her products on foot to markets and grocery stores.

She requested the loan to buy flour, oil, leavening, sugar, baking powder, sweets, flavorings, and marmalade.

Her dream is to set up a bigger bakery with an industrial oven so she doesn't have to use a firewood oven and to increase production and be able to hire more people.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for bread

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Одилжону 34 года. Он женат и отец двоих детей. Его жена домохозяйка, она сидит дома и воспитывает детей. У Одилжон высшее медицинское образование. По окончании медицинского института он работал в родильном доме города Вахдат, однако из-за маленькой заработной платы он уволился. Сейчас Одилжон нигде не работает. Он хочет заняться услугой такси, так как это дело прибыльнее. У него имеетя 8-летний опыт вождения. Он планирует предоставлять услуги такси по маршрутной линии город Вахдат-торговый центр Садбарг (в городе Душанбе) и в день делать 5 рейсов. С этим намерением Одилжон запрашивает кредит для приобретения автомашины.
texts.en: Odiljon is 34, married, and the father of two. His wife is a homemaker; she stays at home and takes care of the children. After graduating from the medical institute, Odiljon worked in the maternity ward in Vakhdat. But due to the low pay, he resigned. Now he is unemployed. He wants to be a private taxi driver, since this is a lucrative business. He has eight years' driving experience. He plans to offer taxi service between Vakhdat and the Sadbarg commercial center in Dushanbe, and can do about five runs a day. With this goal in mind, Odiljon is requesting a loan to by a car.

loans.use: to buy a car to operate a private taxi service

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 25-year-old Beatrice from the Kambia Northern area in Freetown. She is single with a seven-year-old child who attends school. For the past five years, Beatrice has run a general store where she sells soap, toothpaste, and cream. She works 12 hours a day, seven days a week and this is her only income source. Beatrice's major business challenge is market competition. 

Beatrice is requesting a loan to buy more general stock such as soap, toothpaste, and cream. The extra income from her loan will allow her to take care of her child and become a successful woman. Beatrice plans to open a shop in the future. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy soap, toothpaste, and cream

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is single and, since 2007, has worked selling electrical wires and gadgets in Hohoe. He received education as a technician.  Emmanuel is responsible for his bills and general upkeep.

Emmanuel is requesting a loan to buy electrical bulbs, extension plugs, and ceiling fans. He hopes to use the profits from his loan to save and reinvest into his business.

loans.use: to buy electrical bulbs, extension plugs, and ceiling fans

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married and has three children. She has received schooling through basic level to middle school level. Mercy is a petty trader as well as a food vendor who prepares and sells banku at Akpafu, Hohoe. She has done this for the past 16 years to support herself and her family. To prepare banku, she first prepares corn dough (maize that has been milled and left for a day) and cassava dough. She mixes the cassava and corn dough and cooks them into a porridge-like consistency form. To get the right consistency, she has to stir the mixture on a hot firewood stove. The texture of banku has to be fine, but firm. The accompanying dish can either be any kind of soup or sauce such as palm nut soup, groundnut soup or peanut soup, okra soup, or hot pepper sauce with fish of any kind.

Her husband is a farmer. Mercy uses her income to help her husband with the general upkeep of the home, as well as to support extended family members. Mercy will use the loan to purchase bags of cassava dough, palm fruits, a bag of rice, a gallon of oil, and a bag of onions. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to save and increase her working capital so she can operate a bigger chop bar in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cassava dough, palm fruits, a bag of rice, a gallon of oil, and a bag of onions

loans.name: Fayzi

texts.ru:
Файзи очень трудолюбивый и доброжелательный мужчина в возрасте 55 лет. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. У него дочка и трое сыновей. Сыновья уже все обзавелись своими семьями и живут отдельно. Сам Файзи живёт вместе с женой и дочкой. Он вместе с своей женой и дочкой занимаются выращиванием картофеля . Этим делом Файзи занимается уже более одного года и имеет 1,5 га земли. Этот бизнес дает ему очень хорошую прибыль. Прошлый сезон от урожая  получили хороший доход и их проживания намного улучшилось. 
Дополнительно ее дочка в свободное время занимается откормом скота. У них имеется несколько голов мелко рогатого скота. Но основной доход от выращивания картофеля. На полученный кредит Файзи планирует купить минеральные удобрение для почвы и картофельные семена. Заранее благодарит Арванд за содействие и поддержку.
texts.en:
Faizi is a very hardworking and big-hearted man of 55. He is married and has four children. He has a daughter and three sons. His sons already have their own families and live on their own. Faizi lives with his wife and daughters. He grows potatoes together with his wife and daughters. Faizi has been doing this for more than a year and has 1.5 hectares of land. This business provides him with a very nice profit. Last season he received a good income from the harvest and their living standard improved greatly.

In her free time, his daughter raises livestock as well. They have several head of cattle. But growing potatoes is their main source of income. Faizi plans to use the loan to buy mineral fertilizer and seed potatoes. He thanks Arvand in advance for their assistance and support.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and seed potatoes

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Diep is requesting a new loan to buy quality food to sell in her food stall. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. Diep hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and in boosting sales. This new loan will also help her improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy quality food to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
For years, Rose has operated a poultry farming business, selling to restaurant operators and to her neighbours and passers-by through the support of the previous Kiva loan. She gives much appreciation to Yehu and Kiva at large. She faces a major challenge of infectious diseases leading to loses. Rose dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks, both layers and broilers, and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, both layers and broilers, and chicken feeds.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is married and has 5 children. He has never received any basic schooling even though he wishes he had been to school. James sells locally made sandals in Hohoe market to make ends meet, which he has done for the past 11 years. His wife is a petty trader. James uses his income to pay for all the financial needs of his home and other close relatives. James will use the loan to purchase varieties of sandals and introduce the sales of male and children sandals as well. With the new profits from his expanded business, James intends to save the profit and give a better education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of sandals and introduce the sales of male and children sandals as well.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is in her late forties and divorced with eight children between the ages of five and 25. For the past five years, she has run a bar in the Lunsar Northern area of Sierra Leone. She started her business to take care of her family and she sells stout and beer from her house. Sarah says that her business is doing well. 

Sarah is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more assorted drinks such as soft drinks, stout, and beer. She says that the extra income from her loan will help increase her business and provide for her family's daily meals. In the future, Sarah would like to open a larger bar and entertainment club. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted drinks such as soft drinks, stout, and beer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school and are under her care. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For over one year, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. In addition, she also sells green groceries, which earns her another source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 35 years old. She lives in Gori with her two daughters. Nino has requested a loan from several local financial institutions in order to start a family business. However, she has not had success. Her loan requests were rejected because of the family's low income and poor living conditions. 

Nino’s mother lives in Italy and sends shoes to Nino to sell. This is the only source of income for the family, and it is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs in the subsistence poverty category. 

Nino has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Nino has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people and those who do not have access to credit. These rural poor are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With this loan, Nino will buy bed clothes to sell. She plans to go to Turkey and purchase the bed clothes from wholesalers and then resell the bedding at higher prices. This will increase the income of the family. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy bed clothes to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 46 year old father of three. He describes himself as a determined person. He is applying for a KES 100,000 loan to help him buy steel to enhance production of gutters, thus targetting a larger market in Nakuru region. This is his third sucesful loan with SMEP DTM. He sees himself with a string of workshops in the near future.

loans.use: to produce steel gutters.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past one year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passer-by. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. Mwanamisi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 37 years old and married with three children between the ages of eight and 18. For the past ten years, she has run a food stand in the Lunsar Northern area in Sierra Leone, where she sells plastic, onions, Maggie, oil, milk, and sugar. Kadiatu began her business to earn a permanent income and be independent. Her major business challenges are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Kadiatu is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more plastic, onions, Maggie, oil, milk and sugar. The extra income from her loan will help her to renovate her house and open a savings account. In the future, Kadiatu would like to build a big house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase plastic, onions, Maggie, oil, milk and sugar

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 41-year-old father with 3 children. He describes himself as a hardworking and determined trader who is in the business of baking bread and cakes and suppling them to his location of Nairobi West. He is applying for a KES 50,000 through SMEP DTM to help in production. His profits will be used to expand his business to other regions.

loans.use: to bake bread and cakes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 37-year-old married woman with 6 children. She is located in Nakuru town where she engages in the knitting of woolen products. She is applying for a KES 20,000 loan through SMEP DTM to help her produce more for her customers. This is her first application for a loan. She also owns a poshomill and has a vision of knitting uniforms for schools.

loans.use: to knit woolen products.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 34-year-old Fatmata from the Lunsar Northern area. She is married with four children between the ages of five years and 18. Two of her children attend school. For the past 15 years, Fatmata has been running a clothing business where she sells clothing, wax cotton (batik), and lace. She works 12 hours a day, seven days a week. Fatmata's major business challenge is transportation. 

Fatmata is requesting a loan to buy wax cotton and lace. She will use the extra income from her loan to educate her children and increase her stock of clothing materials. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy wax cotton (batik) and lace

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 38-year-old married father of 2. He describes himself as a creative and socializing person who is friendly. He is applying for a loan of KES 20,000 through SMEP DTM to buy more fruits, vegetables and charcoal. This is second succesful loan and his previous was KES 10,000 and was paid fully.

He sees himself as expanding his business and owning stores to suply the traders along Nairobi-Nakuru highway by suppling them with adequate fruits, vegetables and charcoal.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en: Luong is requesting a new loan to upgrade her internet cafe by buying more new game cards, upgrading computers and buying some new equipment. Luong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to upgrade her internet cafe by buying more new game cards, upgrading computers and buying some new equipment.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Asha has operated a business selling petrol and fuel. She sells this from her home to motorcycle operators and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the stiff competition from other fuel retailers.

Asha is requesting a loan to purchase petrol and fuel for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase petrol and fuel for resale.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is requesting a new loan to expand her motorcycle-repair business by buying more spare parts and equipment to satisfy her customers. Mai's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and equipment to serve a larger number of customers.

loans.name: Eria

texts.en:
Eria is aged 37 years and married with 5 children aged 16, 14, 12, 8 and 4. Out the five children,three are school-going. He is a peasant farmer involved in the rearing of cows and crop farming as a way of getting money to look after the family. Eria has been rearing cows since 2008 with some cows for milk and others for sale after they have matured.

Eria wants a loan of 1,000,000 (one million shillings) to expand on his grazing farm and improving the poultry farm. His dream is to improve on the farm and start rearing cross-breed cows which will give him enough milk for selling. However his challenge is changing weather that affects agriculture and the poor road network.

In the photograph is the loan officer with a tie and the client at the grazing land.

loans.use: to buy more cows to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en: Yaw is married and has 4 children. He has never received schooling because he felt like learning a trade. Yaw sells secondhand clothes, especially male trousers, at Hohoe lorry station, which he has done for 5 years now. His wife is a petty trader. Yaw is responsible for the general upkeep of his home. Yaw will use the loan to purchase a bale of male trousers and introduce shirt sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, Yaw plans to save and reinvest into his business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of male trousers and introduce shirt sales.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Isatu from Port Loko in the Northern area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 8 and 18. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2003, Isatu established her salon business. She began her business because, after she graduated from a vocational training school, she decided to start her business to create income, to support her family. She works at the business based on customers' demand. At present, she describes her major problem to be inadequate material available to use in the salon when customers want to do a certain style.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more varieties of hair and hair cream to expand her salon. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business and pay fees for her children. In the future, she plans to open a permanent business site. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of hair and hair cream to expand her salon.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 40-year-old married woman with 8 children. She plans to plant agricultural products such as pyrethrum, potatoes, peas, and maize. She is appylying for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy seeds for potatoes, peas, maize, and pyrethrum. This is her first loan application through SMEP DTM, and thus would enhance the growth of her business. She sees herself in the near future having bought enough land to supply her members in Nakuru town with enogh food produce.

loans.use: to buy seeds for  potatoes, peas, maize, and pyrethrum.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Memunatu from the Lunsar Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of nine and 20. Three of her children are currently attending school. Memunatu established her general store in 2009 to create income to improve her standard of living. She works seven days a week, 15 hours a day. Memunatu's major business challenge is transportation.

Memunatu is requesting a loan to buy more soap, milk, toothpaste, and sardines. She hopes that the extra income from her loan will allow her to take good care of her family. In the future, Memunatu plans to build a permanent residence for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soap, milk, toothpaste, and sardines

loans.name: Joynab

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Joynab from the Lunsar Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is divorced with three children between the ages of 10 and 17. Her children are currently attending school. Since 1993, Joynab has run a general store in her community where she sells rum, biscuits, pure water, and soft drinks. She works every day, 11 hours per day. Joynab's major business challenges are the poor road network and her insufficient capital.

Joynab is requesting a loan to buy more rum, biscuits, pure water, and soft drinks. She will use the extra income from her loan to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, Joynab plans to build a house and send her children to university. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rum, biscuits, pure water, and soft drinks

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Isatu from Port Loko northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of five and 11. Her children are currently attending school. In 2006, Isatu established her general store business. She began her business because she was trained in business and she thinks it is profitable. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the price inflation of goods.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more soap, rice, sugar, and drinks. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her standard of living and pay her children’s school fees. In the future, Isatu plans to buy a plot of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, rice, sugar, and drinks.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian operates a local chop bar at Hohoe lorry station. She cooks and sells banku and fufu, local Ghanaian dishes. In Ghana, fufu is mostly made from boiled cassava and unripe plantain beaten together. Fufu (also known as foofoo or foufou) is a thick paste usually made by boiling starchy root vegetables in water and pounding with a mortar and pestle until the desired consistency is reached. The malleable dough is served and eaten with a light tomato soup, groundnut soup, palm oil fruit soup or other soups. Banku/Akple is fermented corn/cassava dough mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste. Served with soup, stew or a pepper sauce with fish. The most popular side dish for banku in Ghana is okra stew.  

Vivian is single but has 3 children. She has been in business for the past 9 years. She is responsible for the general upkeep of herself and three other dependents. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize, palm fruits, cassava dough, bags of cassava, plantains, meat, and varieties of fish. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her old age.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize, palm fruits, cassava dough, bags of cassava, plantains, meat, and varieties of fish.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un gendarme. Elle mère de famille. Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1998. Elle vend des céréales pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock. Afi a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait constituer une réserve de céréales qu’elle pourra revendre pendant les périodes de soudure. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir à tous les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Afi is a 37 year old woman. She is married to a policeman. She is a mother. Afi has been working as a reseller since 1998. She sells cereals to all types of customers at the market. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her main difficulty is stock shortages. Afi requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Afi would like to build up a reserve of cereals that she will be able to resell during periods of shortage. She says that with the profits, she plans to meet all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Magrate

texts.en: Magrate is a 27-year-old married woman with 3 children. She is a fish vendor in Nakuru with the motive of starting a hotel which mainly focuses on a sushi menu. This is her second succesful loan with SMEP DTM. She describes herself as determined to succeed. She will use the 40,000 to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman with 3 children. Grace sells bathing sponges, twine, and drying rope near Hohoe lorry station, which she has done to support herself and husband for 6 years now. Her husband is a petty trader. Grace uses her income to assist her husband to feed the home and cater for their children. Grace will use the loan to purchase bundles of rope in different sizes and a variety of sponges. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to save and acquire a shop.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of rope in different sizes and a variety of sponges.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Kadiatu from the Port Loko Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with five children between the ages of one and 18. Three of her children are going to school. Since 2002, Kadiatu has run a business selling different kinds of used clothing. She works throughout the week, 12 hours per day. Kadiatu says that her main business challenges is the slow purchasing power of her customers during the rainy season. 

Kadiatu is requesting a loan to buy more used clothing to sell. The extra income from her loan will allow her to take good care of her family. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a used clothing shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Neneh

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 21-year-old Neneh from the Port Loko northern area in Freetown. She is a married mother blessed with a six-month old child. Since 2011, Neneh has been running a business where she sells different kinds of slippers. Since she did not go to school, she began her business to have a permanent source of income to support her family. Neneh works every day from morning to night. She says that her business is doing well and she has daily sales above 200,000 SLL each day.   

Neneh is requesting a loan to buy a variety of slippers. The extra income from her loan will allow her to repay her loan installments and buy a generator to improve her house. In the future, Neneh plans to build a permanent residence. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy slippers to sell

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a married man aged 37 years. He has six children aged 18, 16, 10, 9, 7 and 4 years, and out of these children only three attend school. Vincent operates a business dealing in the sale of a local brew commonly known as waragi, and it is his major source of income to look after the family. He also practices agriculture but on a smaller scale as an additional source of income.

Vicent wants a loan of 1,000,000 (one million shillings) to complete his residential house under construction so that his family can have decent living conditions. Vincent's dream is to educate his children up to high institutions of learning.

However, his major challenge is the poor road network, most especially when it rains, which makes transportation of his waragi to market very difficult.

In the photograph is the loan officer at the forefront and the client at the back. This is the house Vincent wants to complete.

loans.use: to complete his residential house.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Fatmata, from Port Loko. She is married to a teacher and has three children between the ages of 4 and 14. Her children are currently going to school. Her business income is not enough to support the home. 

Fatmata sells general stock items at her house. She sells soap, milk, pure water, and sweets. She has been running this business since 2006. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Fatmata says that her business is going well because she started with a small amount through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited.

Fatmata has requested a loan to buy more soap, milk, pure water, and sweets. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soap, milk, pure water, and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Good Rice Group

texts.fr:
Ananias est membre du groupe GOOD RICE il a 58 ans et est marie . il a 5 enfants, le plus grand a 19 ans et le plus petit a 5 ans. 4 de ses enfants vont à l`école.il a étudie les études sécondaires.

Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter les angrais chimiques. et il n`attend aucunes difficulté pour le remboursement.

ses stratégie pour la croissance de son activité est de demander d`autre pret pour financer son activité. et ses ambitions pour l`activite est de trouver des semences améliores et pour sa famille c`est éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ananias is a member of the group GOOD RICE. He is 58 years old and is married. He has 5 children. The oldest is 19 years old and the youngest 5 years old. Four of his children go to school. He studied secondary school.

He is requesting this loan to buy chemical fertilizers and he doesn't expect any difficulties in repayment.

His strategies for the growth of his business are to ask for other loans to finance his business, and his ambitions for his business are to find better seeds and for his family to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Rospah

texts.en: Rospah is a focused 37-year-old married woman with six children. She applying for a KES 30,000 loan through SMEP DTM to expand her cereal stock for her posho mill. She sees herself in the near future as processing flour and supplying it to residents in Nakuru. She is also a farmer who plants food crops to sustain her family.

loans.use: to stock cereals at her posho mill.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be capital to expand the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to to open another butchery business. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to open another butchery business.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
This is Cristita, 57, resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Joel, her business partner, and a father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Cristita operates a meat stall. She buys slaughtered hogs, cuts them into smaller portions, then sells them per kilo. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of their freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales, every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of pork, needed in her business. 

Cristita dreams to expand her business and have her own stall in the market. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for pork that she can sell per kilo.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 25-year-old married man with a child. He describes himself as an honest and faithful man. He is applying for a loan of KES 20,000 through SMEP DTM. This is his second loan. He plans to purchase fertilizer and seeds so as to farm crops to enable him sustain his family. He sees himself in five years as expanded and owning more land for farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Mabinty from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 8 and 17. Her children are currently attending school. In 1998, Mabinty established her general stock business. She began her business because she needs to create a permanent source of income to support the home. She works at the business throughout the week, 12 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy more books, biscuits and sugar. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Mabinty plans to expand her business to a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more books, biscuits and sugar.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu is 25 years old and married with one child aged five. She runs a clothing business in Port Loko in the northern area of Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for three years and sells waxed cotton and slippers.  She says that the main challenge to her business is low purchasing power during rainy season.

Abibatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more waxed cotton and slippers. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her support her child and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more waxed cotton and slippers.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Emma from Port Loko in the northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children between the ages of three and 15. Her children are currently attending school

Emma runs a bakery business; she sells cake and bread. She has been running this business since 2009. She works at the business throughout the week. Her business is the only income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business that the heat of the oven sometimes disturbs her health.

Emma has requested a loan in order to buy sugar, cooking oil and flour to resell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of herself and her family. In the future, she plans to open a big shop and pay her children’s school fees up to university. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil and flour to resell.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Mariatu from Port Loko in the northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with three children and has four additional dependents that live with her because they are relatives. 

In 2002, Mariatu established her general store business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business every day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to buy more body cream, soap and assorted drinks. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business so she can attract customers and improve her family. In the future, Mariatu plans to import her goods from a neighboring area. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more body cream, soap and assorted drinks.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is 35 years old and married with four children, ages five and 16. She runs a cookery business in Port Loko in the northern part of Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business for three years and sells cooked rice. She says that her business is doing well because out of the proceeds, she is able to feed her children.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy rice, palm oil dry fish and cooking seasoning. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to buy a table and increase her business. In the future, she would like to open a permanent business location to operate her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, dry fish and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
This is Romeo. He previously accessed a PHP 23,000 loan that he used to purchase quantities of raw materials, like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

Romeo would like to apply for another PHP 27,000 loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials, like fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in his business. His profits from business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and his children’s education. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Romeo dreams to have a stall in the market, to be easily seen by customers, and he hopes that his children will finish their studies. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Veronica Alexandra

texts.es:
Alexandra  tiene  32 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo vive con su madre  en  el Cantón Chillanes 

Provincia Bolívar.



Alexandra se dedica al negocio de ropa. 


Solicita el crédito para la compra  de ropa y así poder aumentar su negocio.    



Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Chillanes.
