loans.use: To purchase a number of computers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts and new tires.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 48 years old, married, with three children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. 

To earn a living, Marilyn owns and operates a retail business in the local community. She has been in her business for over six years and earns PHP 2,000 every month. 

She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2010 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods, sugar, and coffee. Her hope is to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Consuelo Janeth

texts.es:
Janet  tiene 39 años de edad es casado tiene cuatro hijos vive con su esposo en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia 

Bolívar.





Es integrante de ventanilla Unión Central Parroquia San José del  Tambo actividad económica agricultura, 

crianza de animales  y comercio la comunidad se encuentra a una hora de la cooperativa.



 
Janet se dedica a la  agricultura como a la siembra de cacao. 




Solicita el crédito para la limpieza de las huertas y tener buena Producción. 



Las  compras lo realizan en la ciudad de  Mata De Cacao.  



Su sueño es ampliar el negocio.  



No tiene ningún desafío que enfrentar.  




En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar queseares domesticas.
texts.en:
Janeth is 39 years old. She is married and has four children. They live in the Chillanes Canton, in the Bolivar province. She is a member of the communal bank "Union Central Parroquia San Jose del Tambo", which focuses on animal breeding, agricultural and commercial activities. The community is located one hour away from the communal bank.
Janeth works in agricultural activities such as planting cocoa. She is asking for this loan to clear the fields and improve crop production. She carries out her purchases in the city of Mata de Cacao.
Her dream is to expand her business. She faces no particular challenges. In her spare time she likes to do household chores.

loans.use: to clear the fields and have good production

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 30 años , es casada y tiene una hija con quien reside en una vivienda alquilada .Irma se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles .Desde muy niña apoyo en el negocio familiar de sus padres de similar rubro pero al alcanzar la mayoría de edad y con la necesidad de crecer personalmente optó por independizarse y muy conocedora del negocio optó junto a su esposo por iniciarse con capital propio en esta actividad .Posee en su negocio diversos productos tales como arroz, azúcar, bolsas de sal, enlatados, aceites , entre otros .
Considera que es un trabajo donde hay buenas ganancias con el cual es posible sustentar la economía familiar.
Tiene en mente seguir trabajando con la motivación que la caracteriza para lograr hacer de su negocio una tienda mayorista esperando mejorar notablemente sus ingresos y por consiguiente su calidad de vida.Este viene a ser su primer crédito con Kiva, agradecida por la oportunidad brindada se compromete a cumplir de manera puntual con el pago se sus cuotas.
Requiere en esta ocasión contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de 5 sacos de arroz y 5 de azúcar esperando de esta manera obtener un mejor precio y abastecerse por un periodo prolongado de estos comestibles con alta demanda entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Irma  is 30 years old. She is married and has a daughter with whom she lives in rented housing. Irma sells groceries for a living. Since she was young, she helped in the her parent's family business in a similar industry. However with coming of age and the need to grow personally she opted to go independent and is very knowledgeable about the business she chose together with her husband starting it with their own money. She has diverse products in her business that include rice, sugar, bags of salt, canned goods, and oils, among others.
She considers it a job where there are good profits with which it is possible to sustain her family economically. She has in her mind to continue working with the motivation of making her business a wholesale store, hoping to significantly improve her income and therefore her quality of life. This is her first loan with Kiva She is grateful for the opportunity provided and she promises to comply with the payment schedule in a punctual manner. She needs 1,000 soles to buy 5 bags of rice and 5 of sugar. In this way she is hoping to get a better price and stock up on these for a prolonged period with high demand among her customers.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Sumber Usaha Group

texts.en:
To increase their businesses, the Sumber Usaha continued to borrow loans from MUK. They felt comfortable having the loan, because they also have been trained by the MUK staff. Ni Wayan is a housewife and her husband works as a farmer on his own land. 

After succeeding with the last loan, Ni Wayan is continuing to borrow a loan to purchase two superior piglets and sell for fattening pigs. Now the price for one superior piglet is IDR 500,000. All the profit from this business is to support her children's education. She hopes the business will grow and she will become a successful pig breeder.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 53 years old, is married and has one child who is in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Vilma has been buying and selling livestock for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Maali

texts.en:
Maali is 38 years old; he is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. He is a peasant farmer, involved in the growing of onions and tomatoes in the outskirts of Kagadi. Maali has been in the business of agriculture since 1998, and it is his major source of income. 

Maali wants a loan of 300,000 shillings (UGX). He will use the loan to pay school fees for his children, because he has just planted and expects the harvest after three months. His major challenges are the seasonality of the agricultural products and the price fluctuations for them, in the market. His dream is to educate his children until they reach higher institutions of learning, so that they can have a better life than his.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his five children

loans.name: Francisco Vicente

texts.es:
Francisco nació en el distrito de Paucartambo pero vive en Challabamba. (El distrito de Challabamba y Paucartambo están ubicados en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 55 años de edad, tiene una relación libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. 

Francisco es un padre responsable que saca adelante a su familia pues él trabaja  en una entidad pública como profesor  y también se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Ya son tres años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien pero siempre necesita capital para comprar mercadería entonces una vecina le invitó a participar del banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” donde se prestaría dinero para comprar mercadería hoy en día él requiere el préstamo para comprar más pollos. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Francisco was born in Paucartambo, but now lives in Challabamba. (Both Challabamba and Paucartambo are located in the Paucartambo province in Cusco, Peru). He is 55 and lives in a common law marriage, from which he has 3 children.

Francisco is a responsible father who supports his family by working in the public sector as a teacher and always raises chickens. 

He has had his own business raising chickens for three years and it is going well, but he always needs capital to buy merchandise so a neighbour invited him to join the communal bank "Virgen de Chanca" where he could loan the money to buy merchandise. On this occasion, he needs the loan to buy more chickens. 

He is grateful to everyone for the loan and promises to be punctual with his repayments.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a farm, planting corn to sell in the local community, to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 4,000 PHP every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010. Now, she has requested a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP. She will use it to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for her crop. Maribeth wants to make improvements to her house, and to improve the general living conditions of her family, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Diosalo

texts.en:
Diosalo is 39 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community, to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 4,000 PHP every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010. Now, she has requested a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP. She will use it to purchase additional products to sell at her store, like shampoo, soap, coffee, sugar and canned goods. Her hope and dream is to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like shampoo, soap, coffee, sugar and canned goods

loans.name: Darling Maria

texts.es:
Darling, 24 años de edad  tiene una venta de 8 años de tener su negocio vive con su mama es soltera, actualmente esta recibiendo un curso para estudiar belleza. 
Ella dice su negocio ha ido mejorando poco a poco gracias al financiamiento que le ha invertido a su negocio comprando variedad de frutas segun la temporada , compra variedad de golosinas y asi poco a poco ha ido agregando mas productos para vender pues desea tener un kiosko donde pueda vender snacks, frutas. Ella dice que su negocio es bueno ya que le genera ganancias aparte de que satisface las necesidades de su clientela. Ella  quiere el crédito para invertirlo en compras de  frutas, golosinas y bisutería ella dice que este crédito le ayudara de mucho ya que va a invertir y agrandar su negocio para generar mayores ingresos y estabilid.
texts.en:
Darling is 24 years old. She has had a sales business for 8 years. She is single and lives with her mother. She is currently attending beauty school.
Darling says her business has improved little by little thanks to the financing received. She has invested on a variety of fruits depending on the season, different sweets and she has slowly added more products to sell because she wants to have a stall where she can sell fruit and sweets. She says her business is good because it generates income and satisfies her customers' needs. She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of fruit, sweets and costume jewelry. Darling says that this loan will help her a lot to expand her business in order to generate more income and have more stability.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, sweets and costume jewelry

loans.name: Goreti

texts.en: Goreti is a 36-year-old, single mother of four children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. For four years, she has been selling clothes, and with the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her family goal is to construct a permanent house in which to reside, because she still lives in a semi-permanent dwelling. Ever-changing customer preferences and inadequate capital affect her business growth. Her dream is to set up a modern boutique. Goreti intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en: Benito is a hard-working father, who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 41 years old and has two school-aged children. He aims to improve his farming business, to increase his production and income, to satisfy his family needs. Due to financial difficulty, he is asking to borrow additional capital of PHP 10,000. He will use the loan to buy the needed fertilizers and herbicides, to sustain his vegetable production. He believes that his loan will enable him to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides that are needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Walter Cesar

texts.es: Don Walter de 50 años de edad, es un señor viudo con cuatro hijos mayores de edad, para él fue muy difícil la pérdida de su esposa ya que le toco ser padre y madre a la vez, pero hoy en día sus hijos trabajan y estudian y los apoya con su labor como maestro de obras ingresos de los cuales también tiene que cubrir los gastos del hogar. Don Walter con este primer crédito que solicita quiere levantar la pared de su casa especialmente la parte de madera que está tan deteriorada que con las lluvias se le mete el agua y es de prioridad repararla para que sus hijos vivan en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Walter, 50, is a widower with four adult children. The loss of his wife was very difficult for him as he had to be both father and mother to his children, but now they work and study and he supports them through his work as a builder, the income from which has to cover the household expenses.

With this first loan that he is requesting, Walter wants to repair the walls of his house, particularly the part currently made of wood as it has been badly damaged by the rain and now lets in water so it is a priority to repair it so that his children can live in good quality conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and stones

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel nació en la ciudad de Challabamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 26 años de edad, tiene una relación unión libre  de la cual tiene dos hijos. 

Maribel es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora vio que los gastos de la familia se incrementaban entonces necesitaba abrir un negocio y entonces con ayuda de su pareja pudo empezar  con el negocio de venta de ropa pero a medida que iba creciendo el negocio se da cuenta que necesita más capital entonces un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” donde se prestaría dinero para comprar más mercadería hoy en día ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como por ejemplo polos, chompas, pantalones, camisas y otras cosas más. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Maribel was born in the city of Challabamba and lives in the city where she was born. (The district of Challabamba is located in the Paucartambo province in Cusco, Peru). She is 26 and lives in a common law marriage, from which she has two children.

Maribel is an enterprising and hard-working woman who realised that as her household expenses were rising she would need to open a business. With her partner's help she was able to start a clothing sales business, but as her business began to grow she realised that she needs more capital. As a result, a group of neighbours invited her to joing the communal bank "Virgen de Chanca" where she could loan the money to buy merchandise. At the moment, she needs the loan to buy clothes like polo shirts, jackets, trousers, shirts and other things.

She is grateful to everyone for the loan and she is committed to repaying the loan according to her payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, for example polo shirts, jackets, trousers, shirts and other things.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a married woman who has three children, aged between one and two years. She has been a cabbage farmer for two years, and her farm is located in a productive area. Edith plans to use the loan to buy seedlings, chemicals and fertilizers. Her customers are local residents and retailers. She sees herself as a regional supplier of cabbages, in the next five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM, and she repaid the previous loan successfully. She is self-motivated and hopes to have a stable farming operation, in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers, chemicals and seedlings

loans.name: Elio Alfredo

texts.es: Don Elio es un  humilde carpintero que habita en la ciudad de Estelí es casado, tiene una hija de ocho años junto con su esposa realiza el trabajo de elaboración de  muebles de hogar hechos con madera  él es un hombre muy  ,es un cliente excelente  el primer crédito lo saco para comprar madera  para su trabajo el hacer todo tipo de muebles a precio económicos este nuevo crédito lo utilizará para cubrir un pedido de puertas y ropero por lo que necesita madera, playwood, lija  pinturas, barniz, clavos etc. Don Elio  dice que después que le dimos el crédito su trabajo aumento en gran manera él está feliz y satisfecho con los logros obtenidos su siguiente paso es renovar los créditos para seguí r mejorando  su sueño es ser un carpintero muy conocido y tener muebles para exhibirlos y en su casa quiere hacerle mejoras ya que quiere darle un buen futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Elio is a humble carpenter who lives in the city of Esteli, he is married and has an 8 year old daughter with his wife. He makes wooden home furnishings as a living and is a very hard-working man. 

He is an excellent customer and took out his first loan to buy wood for his work making all kinds of furniture at affordable prices and he will use this new loan to fund an order of doors and wardrobes, for which he needs wood, plywood, sandpaper, paint, varnish and nails etc. 

Elio says that after we gave him the loan his work greatly increased and he is happy and satisfied with his gains. He is next step is to renew the loan in order to continue improving. His dream is to be a well-known carpenter and exhibit furniture. He would like to make improvements to his home and provide a good future for his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, plywood, sandpaper, paint, varnish and nails

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is married with four school going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Pauline has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past five years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes, a hardworking 47-year-old mother of four school-age children, supports her husband in their vegetable production business to ensure a high yield. Due to the high cost of school fees, they need to increase their income to support their children's education. In order to expand vegetable production, Lourders is requesting a loan of P10,000.00 to buy fertilizers and herbicides.

Through this financial assistance, Lourdes believes that they will have a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed to sustain their vegetable production.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 38 years old, married with four children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. 

To earn a living, Edwin owns a motorcycle transport business in the local community. He has been in his business for over five years and he earns PHP 30,000 every month. 

Edwin joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2010 and now he has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 for repairs and to purchase spare parts and new tires, to improve service.  

In the future, Edwin wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to make repairs and to purchase spare parts and new tires.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school and are still under her care. The family lives in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Christine has a poultry business, selling her birds at the market to town dwellers and restaurant operators. She cites her major challenge as poultry disease outbreaks.

With the loan she is requesting, Christine will purchase medicine and feeds for her poultry. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine and feeds for poultry.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis tiene21 años de edad es de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos vive con su esposa en el  Cantón 

Chillanes Provincia Bolívar.




Es integrante de ventanilla azanloma  perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, la actividad económica es la 

agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio.  



La comunidad se encuentra en unos 30 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa en Chillanes. 



 
Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de frejol, maíz,  panamitos  y  alverja. 




Solicita el crédito  para la compra de frejol. 



Las compras se realizan en la Ciudad de Chillanes.  




Su sueño es comprarse una casa.   



El desafío que enfrenta es la presencia de plagas   como la concha.   




En el tipo  libre le gusta pasear, realizar deporte y las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en: Luis is 21 years old. He lives with his partner in the county of Chillanes, in the province of Bolivar. They have two children. He belongs to a solidarity group in the County of Chillanes. The main economic activities are agriculture, animal husbandry and trade. The community is located 30 minutes from the office of the coop in Chillanes. Luis works in agriculture and plants beans, corn and peas. He is requesting the loan to purchase beans, which can be bought in the city of Chillanes. His dream is to purchase a house. The challenges he faces in his work are pests, such as snails. During his free time, he likes to walk, play sports and attend festive community events.

loans.use: to purchase beans.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a forty-five-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. After realizing that farming alone could not help him in meeting the daily needs of his family, he decided to start a carpentry workshop. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital pose a challenge to his business growth, but his dream is to be a model farmer in the village. Julius intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.use: To rehabilitate his banana plantation

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 29-year-old mother of four. She is married and describes herself as being focused. 

Mercy is applying for a KES 10,000 loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM) to help her purchase another dairy cow, to boost milk production. She sees herself with five dairy cows that will produce milk for supplying the neighboring area of Nakuru. Mercy will be paying the loan in monthly installments.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ebenezer 1, 2, 3, 4 & 6 Group

texts.fr:
Gislaine est la coordonatrice de son groupe Ebenezer 1, 2, 3 4 & 6. Elle habite dans la région de Ouanaminthe d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle est célibataire et elle n'a pas d'enfants. 

Gislaine a dirigé son commerce de produits divers pendant les 7 dernières années. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à plus de produits. Des autres membres du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour faire du commerce comme vendre des produits alimentaires, charbon et des produits cosmetique. 

Gislaine dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce et ayant une entreprise prospère.
texts.en:
Gislaine is the coordinator of her group Eben ezer 1, 2, 3, 4, and 6. She lives in the Ouanaminthe region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very limited. She is single and doesn't have any children. 

Gislaine has run her business selling various products for the past 7 years. She would like to use this loan to invest in more products. Other members of the group need a loan to sell food products, charcoal, and cosmetics. 

Gislaine said that her dream is to grow her business and to have a prosperous company.

loans.use: to buy various products (shoes, clothing, etc.)

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 25-year-old single man. He has been selling electrical appliances for 9 years. He was only 16 years old when he started working in this domain, and he is well known in the region. He also works as an electrician, and the shop is an additional income business, from which he benefits when he is working in a certain construction project.

Mahmoud is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his business capital with newly released electric items that are highly requested in the projects on which he is working.

Mahmoud is very excited for this loan, because he is sure that it will have a very positive effect on improving both his social and financial situations.

loans.use: to buy newly released electric needs.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 26-year-old single man who lives with his parents in a rural area called Taiz governorate. He is a secondary school graduate. Ali works in a bakery where he distributes bread and cakes to groceries. He accumulated a small amount of money to buy a tok tok, but it is not enough. Therefore, he asked for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. The tok tok will facilitate his work and enable him to expand his work and start selling merchandise to groceries beside bread and cake. He hopes this will increase his income and improve his living conditions. He looks forward to being the largest distributor in the market.

loans.use: to buy a tok-tok to use for business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 6 years and earns 13,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee and eggs.  In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee and eggs

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 25 years old, married, and has two infant-aged children. He aims to uplift their status of living to give his family a better life. 

Joel planned to expand his vegetable production in order to have a high production. Due to financial difficulty, he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy the fertilizer and insecticides needed to sustain his vegetable production. 

He believes that through his patience and hard work, he will improve his farming business and he is hoping that he will become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides needed to sustain his crop production.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de antojitos. Ella está divorciada, tiene dos hijos los cuales tienen edades de 16 y 18 años, no tiene familiares en el extranjero; el oficio al que se dedica lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y lo lleva a cabo de 10:00 am a 7:00 pm.
El crédito  lo invertira en la compra de repollo, maíz, vinagre, plátanos, yuca, entre otros; este le ayudara a tener más variedad para los gustos de los clientes y aumentar sus ventas.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio, incrementar la clientela y mejorar la economía.
texts.en:
Ana makes a living selling snacks.  She's divorced and has two children, ages 16 and 18.  She has no family members abroad.  She learned her job on her own initiative and she works from 10 a.m. until 7 p.m.

She'll invest the loan in buying cabbage, corn, vinegar, plantains, yucca, and other food.  This will help her have more variety for her customers' tastes and to improve her sales.

Her dream is to improve her business, increase her customers, and improve her finances.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, corn, vinegar, plantains, yucca, and other food

loans.name: Luis Gonzalo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 38 años de edad es de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos  vive con su esposa e hijos en el 

Cantan Chillanes Provincia   Bolívar. 



Es integrante de ventanilla azanloma  perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, la actividad económica es la 

agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio.  



La comunidad se encuentra en unos 30 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa en Chillanes.  



Luis se  dedica a la agricultura como a la siembra de maíz, frejol  y a la crianza de animales como los 


cerdos,  gallinas y ganado.  


Solicita el crédito  para la compra de ganado.  


Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Chillanes. 


Su sueño es comprar terreno y dar el estudio a los hijos.  



El desafío que enfrenta es exceso de plagas en los cultivos.  



En el tiempo libre le gusta  dedicarse a la familia y realizar deporte.
texts.en:
Luis, 38, is in a common-law marriage and has two children.  He lives with his wife and children in Chillanes Canton in Bolívar Province.

He's a member of Azanloma Communal Bank in Chillanes Canton, where the economic activities are agriculture, raising animals, and commerce.  The community is located some 30 minutes from the co-operative office in Chillanes.

Luis makes a living in agriculture growing corn and beans and raising animals such as pigs, chickens, and livestock.

He's requesting the loan to buy livestock.  He makes his purchases in the city of Chillanes.

His dream is to buy a plot of land and give his children an education.  The challenge he faces is excessive pests in his crops.  He likes to devote his free time to his family and to playing sports.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Oscar Cayetano

texts.es:
Oscar, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de la agricultura; este le permitirá comprar materiales agricolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas y todo lo necesario para la preparación de la tierra, asimismo adquirir semilla.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar los ingresos y poder sacar una buena cosecha; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantiene igual.
texts.en:
Oscar is requesting a new loan to invest more in his business in agriculture.  This will allow him to buy agricultural supplies such as soil amendments, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, and everything he needs to prepare the land.  He'll also buy seed.

The previous loan helped him improve his income and get a good harvest.  His economic situation has improved and his family circumstances are the same.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, and seed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: construct cages and buy chicks.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio de 53 años de edad , esta casado con Paulina y tiene 5 hijos , 2 de los cuales ya son personas trabajadoras e independientes.Lucio se dedica a la venta de ropas al por menor en un puesto ubicado dentro del mercado de abastos de su localidad.Al comenzar con su negocio solo tenía un poco de mercadería pero de a pocos logro incrementarlo.Cuenta constantemente con el apoyo de sus hijos y esposa en momentos que no puede permanecer en su negocio.Tiene como objetivo seguir trabajando con la motivación que la caracteriza junto a su familia para lograr a futuro ampliar su negocio y porque no aperturar una sucursal en su domicilio esperando mejorar su economía familiar.Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y está muy agradecido por el apoyo que recibe razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles e invertir en la compra de más polos y pantalones para caballeros puesto que poseen una buena demanda.
texts.en:
Lucio, 53, is married to Paulina and has 5 children, two of whom are hard-working and independent people. Lucio sells clothes at a stall in his local market. When he started his business, he had very little merchandise but he managed to increase his stock little by little. He counts on the support of his wife and children at times when he can't stay in his shop. 

His aim is to keep working, with the motivation that it allows him and his family to achieve a full future with their business and because he wants to open a branch in his home, hoping to improve his family's financial situation. This is his first Kiva loan and he is very grateful for the support he is receiving so he is committed to making his repayments punctually.

He would like to borrow 1000 PEN and invest it buying more men's polo shirts and trousers as they are in demand.

loans.use: to buy men's polo shirts and trousers.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina de 52 años de edad , es madre soltera de tres hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera .Marcelina se dedica a la venta de diversa variedad de prendas de vestir en un puesto dentro del mercado de abastos de su localidad.Para mantener abastecido su negocio debe de viajar a la capital de su región para adquirir diversas prendas principalmente para damas.
Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es el de trabajar con la máxima motivación posible y cumplir uno de sus sueños el cual consiste en la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble. Este es su tercer crédito con Kiva y está muy agradecida por contar siempre con el apoyo financiero que recibe.
Desea en esta ocasión contar con 2,000 nuevos soles e invertirlos en la compra de blusas, polos de moda y demás prendas de mayor demanda en su localidad.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 52 yars old and is a single mother of three children who live in her wooden house.  Marcelina works in selling a variety of garments in a stall within a market in her region.  To keep her business supplied she needs to travel to the capital of her region to acquire diverse garments, primarily for women.

One of her primary long-term goals is to work with the highest motivation possible and complete one of her dreams which consists of constructing a home with a higher quality base.  This is her third loan with Kiva and she is very grateful to be able to count on the financial assistance she receives.  

She hopes to count on 2,000 nuevos soles and invest them in buying blouses, stylish polos and other garments of high demand in her region.

loans.use: to buy polos and blouses among other things

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 41 años,posee una vivienda hecha a base de material noble llegando a compartir sus vivencias familiares junto a sus 4 menores hijos que son su principal motivo de vida.Posee un puesto de comestibles en donde se dedica a la venta de diversos  productos tales como víveres entre los cuales destacan los de primera necesidad como el arroz, azúcar, cereales, enlatados y otros para la preparación de alimentos.
Se inicio con capital propio que acumulo con el tiempo , el cual logro incrementar con el tiempo hasta convertirlo en un buen sustento de su economía familiar con el único propósito de brindarles a sus pequeños una mejor calidad de vida posible.Este viene a ser su segundo crédito otorgado por Kiva y está muy agradecida por la  confianza brindada razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea en esta ocasión contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para adquirir productos al por mayor tales como sacos de arroz, azúcar, verduras , cereales y otros de mayor demanda para asegurar el stock de su negocio por un periodo prolongado ya que es la mejor manera de atraer clientela según comenta.
texts.en:
Raquel is 41 years old.  She has a home made of superior quality material and shares her home with her 4 youngest sons, whom are her primary motivation in life.  She has a grocery stall where she works in selling diverse products and supplies, among which are products of high necessity like rice, sugar, grains, canned foods, and other products for preparing food.

She started her business with her own capital, which she accumulated with time.  She was able to increase it with time until she could convert her business into something that could sustain her family economically.  Her only purpose is to offer her children as high a quality of life as possible.

This will be her second loan awarded through Kiva and she is very grateful for the confidence offered, since she pledges to pay her quotas on time.

She hopes to count on 3,000 nuevos soles to acquire wholesale products like sacks of rice, sugar, vegetables, grains and other that are high demand to assure that her business is well stocked for a long period of time since this is the best way to attract clients, according to her.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar and vegetables among others.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 45-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 33 years, she has been operating a drug shop business and also rearing goats. With the proceeds, she has been able to buy land and pay school fees for her children. High license fees and stiff competition pose a challenge to her business growth, while her dream is to own a pharmacy. Robina intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and has been blessed with nine children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She cites food and school fees as her major challenges.

Rehema has operated a coconut business, which she sells on a retail basis to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of bulkiness of goods, hence a high cost of transportation. 

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Don jorge de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 18 años de edad el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años su principal siembra es el maiz y el frijol cuando ya esta lista su cosecha la va almacenando en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a venderlos con los comerciantes de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, Don Jorge solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar insumos agricolas como: semillas, fertilzantes, abonos, pesticidas, entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra y poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Jorge, 51 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and his 18-year-old son. He has been a farmer for 15 years. His main crops are corn and beans. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granary shown in the photograph and then goes to sell it to staple grain merchants near where he lives. Jorge is asking for a loan that will allow him to be able to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, manure, and pesticides, among other things that he needs for his crops, and to be able to obtain a better income to give his family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Naum

texts.en:
Naum is a married lady, aged 29, blessed with two children, aged 8 and 1 year old.  She owns a retail shop and has been in operation for a period of seven years, earning an income of 12,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).  

She has borrowed a fifth loan of 80,000 KES from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase stock of dry maize and beans for resale.  

The anticipated amounts will be used to develop her plot and build more rentals. Her dream is to expand her cereals business and live happily with her family.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize and beans for sale.

loans.name: Jose Patricio

texts.es: Don jose de 46 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 25 años siembra maiz y sorgo cuando ya ha recogido su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlas a las agencias de granos basicos y con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos de los gastos que tiene en su hogar; vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 17 y 22 años, Don Jose solicita un credito que le permita comprar todo lo necesario para seguir con su cosecha como: semillas, pesticidas, fertilizantes, abonos, entre otros pues es su unica fuente de trabajo y asi podra obtener mejores ganancias de sus ventas y le podra dar a su familia sin limitacion alguna todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en: Jose, 46 years old, has been a farmer for 25 years. He grows corn and sorghum. When he has brought in his crop, he stores it in the granaries shown in the photograph and then sells it to staple grain agencies. He covers some of his household's expenses with the earnings that he receives. He lives in his own house with his wife and his two children, aged 17 and 22 years. Jose is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy everything necessary to continue with his crop, such as seeds, pesticides, fertilizers, and manure, among others, since it is his only source of work. In this way he will be able to obtain a better income from his sales and give his family everything they need with no limitations.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
José  tiene 48 años de edad tiene un hijo vive con su madre y su hijo en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia 

Bolívar.



Es integrante de ventanilla azanloma  perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, la actividad económica es la 

agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio.  



La comunidad se encuentra en unos 30 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa en Chillanes.


  
José se dedica a la agricultura como a  la siembra de maíz, frejol,  arveja y a la crianza de animales como 


la crianza de ganado, cerdos,  gallinas y cuyes.  


Solicita   el crédito para compra de ganados.  


Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Chillanes.   

Su sueño es comprar terreno para el cultivo.   El desafío que enfrenta es presencia de plagas en el cultivo.  En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer  realizar deporte, salir a pasear en el pueblo y fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Jose is 48 years old and has a son.  He lives with his mother and son in the region of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar.
He is a member of the Azanloma community bank, pertaining to the region of Chillanes.  His business is agriculture and raising and selling animals.  His community is 30 minutes from the office of  the Chillanes cooperative.

Hose works in agriculture, for example growing corn, beans, peans and raising animals like cattle, pigs, chickens and guinea pigs.  He is requesting the loan to buy livestock.  His purchases are made in the city of Chillanes.

His dream is to buy land to cultivate.  The challenge he faces is the presence of pests in his plants.  In his free time he likes to play sports, go for walks in the town and go to parties in the community.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Dandra

texts.en:
Dandra has been in the lawn care business since the age of 7. Now he’s 47 and a father of 11 – and he has been running his business professionally under the name of Integrity Grass Sales and Services for the past four years. 

Dandra chose the name Integrity because it constantly reminds clients of his trustworthiness.  He believes he’s not better than others, but is serious about offering good service, affordable prices and quality care. He was born in Bay City, Texas, but moved  as a young adult to Houston, where he mastered the art of sales.  He later relocated to Hitchcock, in Galveston County, not far from where he grew up. 

Dandra was referred to Accion Texas through the Small Business Development Center at the University of Houston.  His $5,450 equipment and supply loan will allow him to purchase fertilizers, lawn mowers and gardening tools, and pay employees.  This will allow him to take on more customers and finish more jobs efficiently and expand his services.  He currently employs three full-time people and says the expansion will allow him to hire more in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, lawn mowers and gardening tools, and pay employees.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
José owns and operates a start-up sole proprietorship called Novedades J & D in Pasadena, Texas – a suburb of Houston.  The company will sell purses and other accessories and provide a place for people to make phone payments.  

José is currently employed by Super Page, and he will continue to work there while he runs J&D on the side.  He will open the business in an area flea market. In addition, José’s wife will manage this business with him. He currently has one full-time staff member and will be hiring more employees in the future.

His $5,450 loan from Accion Texas enabled him to purchase his initial inventory, including purses, sunglasses and other accessories. “I really appreciate Accion’s help,” José says.  “I’ll be able to grow my business now!”

loans.use: to purchase inventory including purses, sunglasses and other accessories.

loans.name: Ahtam

texts.ru: Ахтам человек с доброй душой. Он живет в столице, где можно развивать свой бизнес и реализовать свои идеи. Он женат и имеет 3 детей. Ахтаму 51 лет. Он посвятил всю свою жизнь своей семье. Он всегда старается обеспечить семью с высококачественными продуктами питания и модной одеждой. Он более 30 лет работает в транспортной организации и имеет хорошую деловую репутацию. Он получает маленькую зарплату и поэтому его сыновья хотят уезжать в Российскую Федерацию на заработки. То есть они будут работать разнорабочими, и таким образом они будут зарабатывать на жизнь. Ахтам запрашивает займ для покупки авиабилета. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ahtam is a person with a kind soul.  He lives in the capital, where he can develop his own business and realize his ideas.  He is married and has three children.  Ahtam is 51 years old.  He devoted all of his life to his family.  He always tries to provide his family with a high-quality food products and stylish clothing.  He has been working at a transport organization for over 30 years and has a good business reputation.  He earns a small salary, and this is why his sons want to leave to go to the Russian Federation for work.  More precisely, they will work as handymen and earn a living this way.  Ahtam is requesting this loan to purchase an airline ticket.  He awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.

loans.use: to buy an airline ticket to go to Russia and look for work

loans.name: Akbarjon

texts.ru: Акбарчон добродушный и целеустремленный человек. Ему 26 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Его дети еще не совершеннолетние. Мать Акбарчона живет с ними. Акбарчон старается больше зарабатывать деньги и обеспечить семью со всеми необходимыми средствами. Акбарчон более 1 года занимается услугой такси. Он живет в столице, где много народа используют такси. Он всегда старается предоставить высококачественную услугу. Благодаря хорошему сервису он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Он должен отремонтировать машину, так как его машина имеет плохое состояние. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для ремонта автомобиля. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Akbarjon is a kind and driven person.  He is 26 years old.  He is married and raising two children, who are not yet of age.  Akbarjon's mother lives with them.  Akbarjon tries to earn more money and provide the family with all of the necessities.  Akbarjon has been involved in providing a taxi service for over a year.  He lives in a capital, where a lot of people use a taxi service.  He always tries to provide a high-quality service.  Thanks to the good service, he has his own regular clients.  He has to repair his car because it is in a bad condition.  Akbarjon is requesting a loan in the amount of 7500 somoni to repair his car.  He relies on your kindness and promises to repay the loan on-time.

loans.use: to repair his car which is the source of his income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover operating expenses and rennovate his studio

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 41-year-old father of four children. He describes himself as a determined person, focusing to give his family a better life. 

He is applying for a KES 50,000 loan through SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM) to stock fruits and vegetables in his grocery store. 

He sees himself in five years with various grocery stores, along Nakuru town. He describes the town as a competitive place for doing business.

loans.use: to stock fruits and vegetables in his grocery store.

loans.name: Rwensenene Kweterana Group

texts.en:
Mable is a hard-working woman, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer who grows crops, but also rears cattle for milk production. She faces a hardship of unpredictable weather changes while her dreams are to venture into modern farming and also to educate her children up to the University.

Mable intends to use the loan to buy seedlings and to pay workers who are helping her clear the garden. She is a member of the above-mentioned group in which each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and to pay workers who are helping her clear the garden.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling coconut vinegar in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish-vending. Emma is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy empty containers for her coconut vinegar.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy empty containers for her coconut vinegar.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 29-year-old single lady with two children. She describes herself as an optimistic lady who is focused on her business. 

She is applying for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy electronics for her electronics business. Her previous loan was paid back successfully. She plans to use the profits for the payment of school fees for her children. Challenges facing her in Nairobi are the high rent rates.

loans.use: To buy electronics for her electronics business.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina de 47 años de edad posee una vivienda hecha a base de adobe y vive junto a sus 2 hijos. Agustina vende diversa variedad de prendas de vestir preferentemente para damas en su stand ubicado dentro del mercado de abastos en su localidad.Con la habilidad que tiene para las ventas ha superado su inconveniente económico y logra hoy en día a través de sus ventas para damas tales como blusas clásicas traídos  desde otra localidad son de gran demanda en su localidad .Espera seguir trabajando con la fuerza de superación que la caracteriza para concretar la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble esperando mejorar la calidad de vida familiar.
En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y ampliar su capital para adquirir mas blusas clásicas al por mayor esperando aprovechar la buena demanda por las festividades del día de la madre.
texts.en:
Agustina is 47 years old, has an adobe house, and lives there with her two children.  Agustina sells different types of clothing, mainly for women, from her stand located in her neighborhood market.  Her sales ability has allowed her to surpass her financial challenges and now sells ladies’ items such as classic blouses from other areas, which are in high demand in her area.  She hopes to continue working toward success, as she is known for, so that she can complete construction of her house with sturdy materials and improve her family’s quality of life.

She is asking for this loan of 1,000 PEN so she can buy more classic blouses  in quantity and take advantage of the high demand over the mother’s day season.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарходу 26 лет. Он женат, но не имеет детей. Фарход всегда в поиске нового источника дохода. Он 4 года назад начал свой бизнес услуги такси. Он предоставляет услугу такси местным жителям и старается предоставлять свои услуги на высшем уровне, так как конкуренция большая. Фарходу очень нравится его работа, он общается с новыми людьми каждый день и получает позитива от этого. Фарход должен срочно отремонтировать свою машину, так как его машина имеет плохое состояние. Если он не сделает ремонт, то потеряет своих клиентов. Фарход не имеет денег для проведения ремонта и поэтому запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для проведения ремонта своей машины. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Farhod is 26 years old, married, but does not have children.  Farhod is always searching for a new source of income.  He started his own taxi service business four years ago.  He provides a taxi service to local residents and tries to provide his service at the highest level because the competition is high.  Farhod likes his work very much.  He interacts with new people every day and receives positivity from this.  Farhod must urgently repair his car because it is in a bad condition.  If he does not repair it, then he will loose his clients.  Farhod does not have money to make repairs and this is why he is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to repair his car.  He awaits your kindness and promises to repay the loan on-time.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a widow and has been blessed with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mejumaa cooks mahamri (dumplings), to sell from door to door. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the KES 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase food ingredients, such as wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, such as wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Lorda

texts.en:
Lorda is 47 years old and married with four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorda requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorda has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Saichandan

texts.en:
Saichandan is a 25-year-old differently-able person. He lives with his parents in a village in Odisha. Saichandan is running his bamboo craft business with the help of his father. He had an interest in arts in his childhood, so he took a training session on designing and making of bamboo crafts. After taking the training he is producing different items like  decorative bamboo planter boxes, small bamboo containers, bamboo picture frames, and other bamboo gift items, etc. 

For two years now he has been producing various craft items made from bamboo and selling them at different gift centres, tourist places and fairs. His  father helps him to supply those finished products to the dealers in the market.

Saichandan  plans to expand his business, appoint new work staff to help him, and to own a shop in the marketplace for direct sale of the product to end customers. He needs a loan of 50,000 INR to buy more resources and machines like  a cutter, cutoff saws, dryers etc. to produce more and earn more than his present income.

He wants to earn more and save for his future and construct a house for his family and live a happy life.

loans.use: to buy more resources and machines like a cutter, cutoff saws, dryers etc. for his bamboo craft business

loans.name: Salinah

texts.en:
Salinah is a 65-year-old married woman with 10 children. She is a farmer and is focused on her dairy which produces milk. 

She is applying for a KES 30,000 loan with SMEP DTM that will enable her to expand her business and supply milk to the neighbouring town, Nakuru. The profits will be used to pay for her childrens' education.

loans.use: To buy food for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is 29 years old, married with three children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like noodles, coffee, sugar, shampoo and soap.  In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like noodles, coffee, sugar, shampoo and soap

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married woman with 10 children. She is applying for a Kes 10,000 loan through SMEP DTM to enable her to plant farm produce  like maize, tomatoes and beans. She will be able to buy seeds for crops to plant through the loan and supply the neighboring market of Nakuru town thus getting more customers for expansion of the business. She plans to repay her loan through monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy seeds for crops to plant

loans.name: Flamingo Group

texts.en:
MOHAMED has been running an electronics shop selling electronics spare parts for a period of three years now. He is also an electrician.  He is a single man aged mid-20s with a son who is still young. He is doing fine in this field and his family is as well. He works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be his second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to restock more TVs spare parts. With the returns earned he covered household expenses together with reinvesting back into the business . He will use this loan to restock more electronics spare parts for his shop. He dreams of expanding his business.

He will share this loan with his loan group " FLAMINGO " which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more electronics spare parts for his shop.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is married and has been blessed with four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She cites paying for food and school fees as her major challenges.

Josphine has operated a vegetable and fruit-selling business in which she sells retail to her neighbors and town-dwellers. She faces a major business challenge of the bulkiness of her goods and, hence, the high cost of transportation. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, Josphine wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 32-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is agriculture but he also earns a salary as a teacher. Like most farmers he is faced with challenges of unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations while his dreams are to expand his piggery project, educate his children up to University level and improve on the condition of his residential house. 

Robert intends to use the loan to renovate his house.

loans.use: To renovate his house.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married with six children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman and he supports his family financially. They live in their own house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Mwanakombo operates a poultry business, selling at the market to her neighbor’s and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her business. 

With KES 20,000 she wants to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feeds. She dreams of expanding to her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a forty-seven-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For fifteen years she has been selling clothes and the business has been very lucrative. 

Her passion for fashion drove her into business and with the proceeds she has been able to educate her children and meet all other family expenses. Ever changing customer preferences and prolonged rainy seasons affect her business while her dream is to own a fashion house. Rose intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is married and has seven children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a firewood selling business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. Mjeni faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of incorporating charcoal into her existing business in the near future.

With the loan she is requesting she plans to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is a married 31-year-old father of four children. He describes himself as an honest and faithful person. He is applying for a KES 20,000 loan through SMEP DTM to enhance his business buy buying a variety of products for his retail shop.

His other source of business include farming and quarrying. This is his first application for a loan. He sees himself with a variety of shops in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his shop.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 33 years old, and has three children with her live-in partner. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a business selling fruits and vegetables in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over four years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

She joined in GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family's basic needs.

Halima has operated a coconut selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her business.  She dreams of expanding her existing business to earn more profits. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 20 sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais uma irmã que vive com ela.
É comerciante vende produtos diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (óleo, cerveja, arroz, refrescos, farinha, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio e voltar a estudar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é investir mais no seu negócio e economizar para poder pagar o empréstimo solicitado.
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother of 2 children who go to School; she lives in a house she owns and supports a sister who lives with her.

She's a trader and sells various products. With this loan she plans to buy products (oil, beer, rice, sodas, flour and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future Ana hopes to grow her business and go back to school. To this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku. 

Her challenge is to invest even more in her business and save to be able to pay for the loan she has requested.

loans.use: buy products (oil, beer, rice, sodas, flour and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Honorato

texts.es:
Honorato nació en la comunidad de Mika y vive en esta misma comunidad. (La comunidad de Mika está localizada en el distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 40 años de edad, es casado por este lazo matrimonial tiene cuatro hijos. 

Honorato es un padre emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a la agricultura y brinda servicio de transporte, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa, cebada, maíz, oca y otras cosas más. 

Un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Intipakareq” porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar  fertilizantes y semillas. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Honorato was born in the community of Mika and still lives there. The community of Mika is located in the District of Colquepata in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Peru.

Honorato is 40 years old, married, and has four children. He is an enterprising and hardworking father who works as a farmer and provides transportation services. He has several plots of land on which he grows potatoes, barley, corn, oca, and other crops.

A group of neighbors invited him to participate in the “Intipakareq” Communal Bank because he is a responsible and cheerful person. Honorato is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that he can buy fertilizers and seeds. He thanks everyone for this loan and promises to be punctual with his payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La clienta vive en Guayaquil.  Hace tres años escogió esta actividad porque quería tener una fuente de supervivencia, entonces comenzo a vender cosmeticos, perfumes, cremas, poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos. Tambien pudo consegir un trabajo en una emrpesa donde ella saca copias, en tal lugar trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, y en algunos momentos vende cosmeticos a sus compañeros del trabajo y tambien vende los fines de semana.

La clienta tiene una discapacidad que desde hace años atras tiene problema ya que le fue amputada una de sus extremidades inferiores, por eso ella ahora hace todo lo posible por mejorar sus ingresos. 

No tiene conyugue, ni hijos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mercadería para su negocio de venta de cosmeticos y perfumes, su sueño es poder tener un bazar y conseguir una casa propia.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil. Three years ago, she chose to pursue her line of work because she wanted to have a means of supporting herself. This is how she began selling cosmetics, perfumes, and crèmes, and gradually she was able to improve her income. She was also able to continue her job at a company where she is in charge of making copies. The borrower works at her job from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. She takes some time to sell cosmetics to her coworkers, but she also sells on the weekends.

The borrower has been a living with a disability for a number of years. She had a problem that resulted in the amputation of one of her lower extremities. Now she is doing everything possible to improve her income.

The borrower does not have a husband or children. With this loan, she wants to buy merchandise for her business of selling cosmetics and perfumes. Her dream is to have a bazaar and to acquire a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 32 years old and married with two children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a pedicab transportation service to earn a living. She has been in her business for over four years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. 

Lilian has been a member of GDMPC since 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 48 years old. She sells construction materials. She is married with eight children aged between six and sixteen. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more bricks and stones to use in building. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bricks and stones for sale.

loans.name: Yudi

texts.es: Yudy  de 35 años , es madre soltera ya que tiene 2 hijos .Reside en una vivienda construida  a base de material noble en calidad de alquiler.Yudy se dedica a brindar el servicio de fotocopiado e impresiones.Anteriormente se desempeñaba como ama de casa, no obstante el deseo de superación le obligo a buscar un negocio con el cual fuera posible sacar adelante a su familia.Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es el de trabajar con la motivación que la caracteriza para posteriormente ser propietaria de la vivienda que ocupa en alquiler cuyo propietario son sus anteriores suegros, quienes desean vender dicho inmueble.Este viene a ser su primer crédito otorgado por Kiva.Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles con el objetivo de realizar un mantenimiento preventivo a su maquina fotocopiadora así como adquirir un nuevo cartucho de tinta, el dinero restante lo invertirá en la compra de mas golosinas y bebidas para mantener surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Yudy, who is 35, is a single mother with two children. She lives in a home she rents, which is built with quality materials. Yudy works providing copying and printing services. She used to be a homemaker, but her desire to improve herself made her find a business that would allow her to provide for her family. 

One of her main long-term goals is to keep working with her usual motivation, so that she can one day become the owner of the home she now rents, which belongs to her old parents-in-law, who are looking to sell the property. 

This is her first loan through Kiva. She wants to have 1,000 nuevos soles in order to do preventive maintenance on her photocopying machine as well as purchase a new ink cartridge. She will invest the rest of the money in buying more drinks and sweets to stock her business.

loans.use: to purchase ink cartridges, sweets, and drinks.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 48 years old and married with eight children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Lilia owns and operates a business, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 4,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.  

In the future, Lilia wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 29-year-old married man with two children. He describes himself as an honest man. 

Paul is applying for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more sugar, cooking fat, salt and other items for his shop. His challenges are inadequate capital, which causes his business not to grow. He wants to focus on the shop; that would help him get money to sustain his family. 

He sees himself in five years established to have a supermarket located in his area of Nakuru town.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, cooking fat, salt and other items for his shop.

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
Silvia, se dedica a la venta de pan. Ella tiene 37 años de edad y disfruta de dos hijos, ellos tiene edades de 5 y 9 años, vive en casa propia  y posee la panadería como una fuente generadora de ingresos; lleva dos años de haber iniciado con el negocio y trabaja de lunes a sábado de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm.
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura y aceite, entre otros productos para la elaboración del pan; esta inversión le permitirá aumentar la capacidad de generar utilidades, incrementar la clientela y sus ingresos con los cuales fortalecerá el negocio.
Su seño es optimizar los ingresos para darles una mejor educación a sus hijos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia sells bread for a living.  She is 37 years old and she has two wonderful children who are five and nine years old.  She lives in her own home and the bakery is her source of income.  She started her business two years ago and she works Monday through Saturday from 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.  

She will use this much-needed loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and oil, among other products to make bread.  This investment will allow her to increase her production capability, expand her clientele, and increase her income, all of which will strengthen her business.

Her dream is to maximize her income so she can offer her children a better education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and oil, among other products

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married 26-year-old with three children. She describes herself as a competent, self-esteemed, and focused wholesaler. She is applying for a loan of KES 20,000 through SMEP DTM to buy sugar, salt, flour and other items for her shop. This will enable her to have a variety of products. 

She is also is engaged in a farming business planting food crops that are supplied to a Nakuru market. She sees herself as a wholesaler operating chains of stores, thus improving her family economically.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, flour and other items for her shop

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
Doña Maria es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora de 51 años y que a pesar de su edad ella no deja de soñar en grande, ella es comerciante y agricultora de su propio producto, casada y con 3 hijos ya mayores de edad cada quien con su familia y apartado en hogar. Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace muchos años ya que esta actividad ha sido medio de sustento para su familia y lo sigue siendo para ella hoy en día con la ayuda de sus hijos que contribuyen a dar el mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café como: poda, limpieza, corte y fertilización del mismo. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en los alrededores de su hogar con algunos vecinos, personas que lo comercializa en pequeña escala en el mercado local y otros. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 1.5 Kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación.

Doña Maria solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas, y una bomba de fumigación para su cultivo de café, ya que hoy en día esta clase de productos son caros y la (roya) que es un hongo dañino de no ser tratado a tiempo contamina y daña una cosecha completa.

Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café la cual pueda seguirles dando bendiciones, sustento familiar y pueda ser trabajada de generación en generación por sus hijos, sus nietos, y las próximas generaciones como hasta el día de hoy se hace formando un patrimonio familiar.
texts.en:
Maria is a fighter and an entrepreneurial woman who is 51 years old. In spite of her age, she has not stopped dreaming big. She is a merchant and farms her own product. She is married and has 3 grown children, each one with their own family and separate home. She has been a farmer for many years, since this activity has been the method of sustaining her family, and it continues to be for herself today with the help of her children, who contribute to the maintenance of her coffee crops by pruning, cleaning, cutting, and fertilizing. Her product is sold in the areas near her home to some neighbors, small-scale merchants in the local market, and others. Her crops are located 1.5 kilometers from her house.

Maria is asking for help to be able to buy fertilizer, manure, insecticide, and a fumigation pump for her coffee crop, since nowadays these kinds of products are expensive, and the rust, which is a damaging fungus, contaminates and damages a whole harvest if it is not treated in time.

Her plans for the future are to have a large coffee plantation that can continue to bless and sustain the family and be worked generation after generation by her children, her grandchildren, and the next generations as it is today, forming a family inheritance.

loans.use: to be able to buy fertilizer, manure, insecticide, and a fumigation pump for her coffee crop

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
Emerita de 55 años de edad ,casada con Marcos quien es empleado, vive con su esposo en su casa propia la cual compro con la ayuda de su esposo.Emerita se dedica a la venta de libros, para esto cuenta con un local la cual está instalada en su hogar de esa manera se ahorra en gastos de alquiler, siendo muy concurrida por los vecinos y extraños que pasan por la zona, a quienes  atiende con amabilidad,  su librería lleva ya 09 años de funcionamiento tiempo en cual a llegado a ser muy conocida y concurrida, contando con el apoyo de su esposo para la atención del publico en sus ratos libres.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se hizo muy conocida en la zona, y que le trae ingreso económicos que le da la tranquilidad necesaria, comenta que escogió esta actividad por la necesidad de contar con un oficio y sentirse una mujer productiva, por tanto  tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo en su rubro y ampliar  su negocio.Este sería su préstamo número 06 con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.
Con el préstamo de S/.2000 nuevos soles, comprará artículos diversos como cuadernos, lapiceros, libros, etc. para surtir su  librería  considera que a mayor variedad mas acogida tendrá su negocio.
texts.en:
Emerita, who is 55 years old, is married to Marcos, who is a worker. She lives with her husband in the home she purchased with his help. Emerita works selling books. Her business is set up in a space located in her home. This allows her to save on rent. Neighbors as well as strangers who come through the area keep her store busy. She serves her customers kindly.
